cases.name: Jeffrey Epstein
cases.description: Federal prosecution for sex trafficking ring involving minors across multiple states. Initial 2008 conviction resulted in controversial plea deal. 2019 federal indictment for additional charges.
cases.sentence: 2008: 18 months (served 13). 2019: Died in custody awaiting trial.
cases.jurisdiction: Southern District of New York, Palm Beach County

cases.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
charges: Transportation of minors for illegal sexual activity
cases.description: Convicted of recruiting and grooming underage girls for sexual abuse by Jeffrey Epstein between 1994 and 2004.

cases.name: Harvey Weinstein
cases.description: Multiple criminal convictions in New York and California for sexual assault and rape. Over 80 women made allegations. Criminal cases resulted in convictions in both jurisdictions.
cases.jurisdiction: New York County, Los Angeles County

cases.name: Dennis Hastert
charges: Structuring cash withdrawals to evade reporting
cases.description: Former House Speaker convicted of financial crimes related to hush money payments to victims of historical sexual abuse he committed while a high school wrestling coach.

cases.name: R. Kelly (Robert Kelly)
cases.description: Federal convictions in New York and Illinois for decades-long pattern of sexual abuse, including minors. RICO enterprise used to facilitate crimes.
cases.jurisdiction: Eastern District of New York, Northern District of Illinois

cases.name: Larry Nassar
cases.position: USA Gymnastics Doctor / Michigan State University Doctor
cases.description: Former USA Gymnastics and MSU doctor convicted of sexually abusing over 265 victims, primarily young gymnasts, under the guise of medical treatment.
cases.sentence: 60 years federal (child porn) + 40-175 years state (assault) = effectively life
cases.jurisdiction: Western District of Michigan, Ingham County MI, Eaton County MI

cases.name: Bill Cosby
cases.description: Convicted in 2018 of sexual assault, served nearly 3 years before Pennsylvania Supreme Court overturned conviction on procedural grounds (prior immunity agreement). Civil settlements with multiple accusers.

cases.name: Donald Trump
charges: Criminal charges pending in multiple jurisdictions
cases.description: Multiple civil judgments including $83.3M defamation verdict (E. Jean Carroll), $454M fraud judgment (NY AG). Criminal indictments in GA (election interference), FL (classified docs), DC (Jan 6), and NY (business records).
cases.jurisdiction: SDNY, Georgia, Florida, DC, New York County
sources: NY AG v. Trump (NY Supreme Court)

cases.name: Matt Gaetz
cases.description: Federal investigation into alleged sex trafficking of a minor and obstruction. DOJ declined to file charges in 2023, but House Ethics Committee investigation continued.

cases.name: Jim Jordan
charges: Alleged failure to report sexual abuse (no criminal charges)
cases.description: Multiple former wrestlers alleged Jordan knew of sexual abuse by team doctor Richard Strauss at Ohio State University (1987-1995) and failed to report. Independent investigation confirmed widespread abuse. No criminal charges against Jordan.
cases.settlement: OSU paid $60M+ to victims; Jordan not charged

cases.name: Derek Chauvin
cases.description: Convicted of murdering George Floyd by kneeling on his neck for over 9 minutes during arrest. State and federal convictions.
cases.jurisdiction: Hennepin County MN, District of Minnesota

cases.name: Brett Hankison
charges: Federal civil rights violations in Breonna Taylor shooting
cases.description: Convicted of federal civil rights violations for reckless actions during raid that killed Breonna Taylor. Fired 10 shots through covered window.

cases.name: Sean Combs (Diddy)
cases.position: Music Mogul / Bad Boy Records Founder
cases.description: Federal indictment on sex trafficking and racketeering charges. Allegations include decades of abuse, coercion, and operating criminal enterprise. Multiple civil lawsuits filed by alleged victims. Currently in custody awaiting trial.
